target: On the nearby planet there appears to be a large circus held by some suspicious looking civilians. It's not likely they'll care if you're a Federation ship.
Check out the circus.

The circus is much more underwhelming and run down than it appeared from above. Most of the attractions and rides look barely functional and definitely not safe. One exhibit however catches your eye, the freak show. On display are 5 aliens, likely slaves, a Slug, Rockman, Orchid, Zoltan, and Engi.
Inspect the Slug.

A bald civilian with an incredibly long beard welcomes you. "Step right up folks, and witness Sazalaraz the All-Seeing! He can see through walls, he can see the future, and he can see into your pockets! So keep a tight hand on your wallet, or next thing you know it might be missing!"
Offer to purchase Sazalaraz.
The man looks at you strangely. "You want to BUY Sazalaraz the All-Seeing? Yeah sure, it'll be 20 bucks."
Pay.
Nevermind.
This isn't worth our time.
Inspect the Rockman.

Offer to purchase Boulder.

Pay.
Nevermind.
This isn't worth our time.
Inspect the Orchid.

A bald civilian with an incredibly long beard welcomes you. "Step right up folks, and witness Sapling the Giver of Joy! A quick inhale of the scent from his leaves and you'll be feeling higher than a kite! Feel free to come forth and have a whiff, but do not, we aren't liable for anything that happens to you."
Offer to purchase Sapling.
The man looks at you strangely. "You want to BUY Sapling the Giver of Joy? Yeah sure, it'll be 20 bucks."
Pay.
Nevermind.

Offer to purchase Namast.
The man looks at you strangely. "You want to BUY Namast the Energized? Yeah sure, it'll be 20 bucks."
Pay.
Nevermind.
This isn't worth our time.
Inspect the Engi.

A bald civilian with an incredibly long beard welcomes you. "Step right up folks, and witness Q-32 the Cyclopean Engineer! He may only have one eye, but he's the master of tech! He can fix anything fast as lightning, debug any problem, and best of all he can't even feel emotions!"
Offer to purchase Q-32.
The man looks at you strangely. "You want to BUY Q-32 the Cyclopean Engineer? Yeah sure, it'll be 20 bucks."
Pay.
Nevermind.
This isn't worth our time.
Ignore the circus.
You have much better things to be doing.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
Continue...
A Rebel appears on the screen, and unfolds a long sheet of paper. He dons a pair of spectacles, and begins to read; "A poem, for you. Ahem; Die."
Your ship is hailed. "We've found you at last. Prepare to die!"
A small Rebel ship is docked at a small station. You try to lay low but it spots you. Power up the weapons!
A Rebel ship has been patrolling this region. As soon as you arrive it begins its assault.
A Rebel ship hails you: "Federation scum! We've waited a long time for this!"
You receive a transmission: "Sorry sir, this is nothing personal but we're under orders." The Rebel ship's weapons go hot.
By the time you notice the Rebel ship behind the beacon, it's too late to avoid a fight.
A Rebel ship hails. "We did not fight a war to let a single Federation ship shatter our dreams of a better galaxy!" He locks weapons.
A Rebel ship approaches cautiously. "Personally," says the captain, "I'd have stuck with the Federation. But I'm a soldier, sir, and I'm no use without a war to fight. Raise your shields!"
You're hailed by a Rebel ship: "When the rebellion is complete you'll see the safer world we provide. Well, you won't, but you get the point." They arm weapons.
You receive a hail from a Rebel fighter: "I'll have you know I graduated top of my class in the-" you cut off the Rebel ship and prepare to fight.
Your arrival coincides almost exactly with that of a Rebel ship. It's hard to know who is more surprised, but there is no option but to fight.
You stumble across a forward scout of the Rebel fleet.
Continue...
Continue...
You receive a message from a nearby Rebel station, "You have a lot of guts passing through our space, I'll give you that." He turns giving an order, "Kill their crew, I want that ship intact."

Your sensors warn of an incoming Rebel ship at the same time as you hear the telltale signs of a teleporter. You hear someone taunt from within the ship, "Ready to die? I sure am ready to get a promotion!"
Incoming message, "Hello Captain," says a Rebel in an officer's garb. "How very generous of you to turn yourself in. Prepare to be boarded. Come quietly and we may be lenient."
You receive a message on a low-band channel. "You're surrounded, just like the last of your Federation friends. Just die already." The enemy has teleported onto your ship!
You arrive at the beacon to find yourself dangerously close to a star. An automated Rebel ship, impervious to the heat, moves in to engage.
Continue...
You arrive in an asteroid belt to discover that a Rebel automated-scout has been stationed here. Prepare for a fight!
Continue...
Rebel ships often try their best to avoid hazardous beacons, but it appears a forward scout of the fleet has gotten lost in this asteroid beacon. Upon seeing you, they turn to attack!
Continue...
Continue...
A Rebel captain appears on the screen. "I thought we had been doomed to backwater assignments. This is my chance to get back in Command's good graces! Charge the weapons!"
A small Rebel research station overlooks a pulsating star. Before you can react a Rebel ship spots you and moves in to attack.
You arrive at an infrequently used beacon close to a pulsar. Before long a Rebel ship happens to jump nearby. Looks like you'll have to fight.
You come across a Rebel automated scout ship pursuing a civilian ship, weapons engaged.
Aid the civilian ship.
You power up your weapons and engage the automated ship.
Continue...
Stay out of it.
The fight brings them out of your immediate scanning range.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
You detect a Rebel ship on an attack approach to a small refuelling outpost. Their weapons are charged, but they're not firing yet.
Intervene to defend the outpost.
The Rebel responds to your threat, "I don't know who you are, but no one defies the Rebel Fleet!" They move in to engage.
Continue...
Avoid the conflict.
The Rebel ship fires some warning shots but eventually powers down their weapons. The outpost seems to have given them what they demanded.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
You detect an automated Rebel scout attacking a small refuelling outpost.
Intervene to defend the outpost.
Detecting the higher threat, the automated ship moves in to engage your ship.
Continue...
Avoid the conflict.
You steer clear of the conflict. The outpost receives a beating but the ship stops its attack before it's destroyed.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
You find an automated sensor station at this beacon, protected by a singular Auto-ship patroling around it.
Attack the automated ship to get to the sensor station.
You prepare to fight.
Continue...
Avoid provoking the ship.
You have no need to stir up trouble with the Rebels.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
(Sensors) Use your sensors to attempt to access the data.
(Teleporter) Beam directly onto the station to try to avoid detection.
Once on board, your crew is able to access and download the long-range scanner's archived information. Your map has been updated.
Your improved Sensors are able to remotely access and download the public radar station's local map data.
The automated ship must be remotely connected to the station; as soon as you attempt to log on, the ship activates and charges you.
Continue...
An advanced Rebel automated ship remains stationed near a small Rebel space-station. Sensors indicate it's a storage vessel for military goods.
Attack the automated ship to get to the storage cache.
You prepare to fight.
Continue...
Avoid provoking the ship.
You have no need to stir up trouble with the Rebels.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
(Cloaking) Attempt to cloak and access the cache.
The ship patrols wide around the area, successfully approaching the station while avoiding detection.
Continue...
Before you can get close enough to scan the station, the automated ship detects you and moves in to attack!
Continue...
The station was either abandoned or stripped clean. It seems to have lain unused for quite some time. You find nothing useful.
The station was apparently designed to outfit Rebel ships with Drone Systems. You find a functioning Schematic.
The station is a storage site for military grade weapons. You find one that can be easily attached to the ship.
The station is a storage site for various resources. You salvage everything possible.
A Rebel automated ship sits dormant near a Rebel forward radar station.
Approach the station.
The ship powers up and targets you.
Continue...
Keep your distance and wait for the FTL to charge.
You have no need to stir up trouble with the Rebels.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
(Combat Drone) Send a drone to distract the automated ship.
Your combat drone attacks the automated ship and then retreats, luring it away. You quickly move up to the radar station to access it.
Continue...
Your combat drone repeatedly fires at the automated ship. It can't break through its shields, but is at least enough of a distraction to allow you to access the radar station.
Continue...
Before your drone has a chance to attack, the automated ship activates and shoots it down. It then detects your ship and moves in on your position.
Continue...
You successfully hack into their system and transmit false information about your location. That should hold off the fleet for at least a little while.
The firewalls prove too difficult to bypass. As you are about to disconnect, you stumble across unprotected information about the surrounding beacons. Your map is updated.
You are unable to penetrate the computer's defenses. You give up and return to the ship.
As you attempt to hack in, you set off a hidden alarm system. It seems that now the Rebels must surely be aware of your position! You hasten back to the ship to jump away.
You find a Rebel automated scout floating near this beacon. Despite its pristine condition, it appears to be de-activated.
Attempt to download the ship's data stores.
Don't risk activating it, and just strip the ship for any useful scrap.
(Sensors) Remotely scan the ship.
You are able to pull all of the ship's data about this sector. Your map has been updated.
You accidentally reactivate the ship's AI. Its weapons immediately go online; prepare for a fight!
Continue...
Your improved Sensors indicate that it's safe to hack into the drone. You upload its map data to your navigation system and strip the ship of useful materials.
Your improved Sensors indicate the ship is on standby, ready to activate at a moment's notice. Will you still attempt to access the ship's data?
Yes.
No.
You leave the ship alone and prepare to jump.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
A Rebel ship is patrolling this beacon, and immediately turns to engage. As your crew scramble to battle readiness, sensors detect a short-range teleporter signal. An intruder is on board!
Continue...
A flushed and panicky Rebel soldier has teleported aboard. The Rebel, who appears unarmed, repeatedly declares his peaceful intentions. It seems the Rebel life has lost its charm.
Accept his proposal, and prepare to fight the Rebel ship.
Reject his offer. You can never trust these Rebels.
Your fearless crew easily overcome the intruder, but the Rebel ship still needs to be dealt with.
Attempting to deal with attacks from inside and out is never easy!
He offers to lead you to a secret cache of scrap nearby if you let him join your crew.
Reluctantly accept his proposal and fight the Rebel ship.
Reject him outright and execute him on the spot.
Reject his offer again.

The dishonorable Rebel has deceived you. He damages your engines and steals your flight data before teleporting away. The fleet will be able to track you with ease. If they can't kill you now that is!
Your new crew-member smiles, then reveals a small remote trigger in the palm of his hand. Explosions rocket around the ship as more intruders teleport aboard!

Arriving at the specified coordinates you find a sizable stash of useful materials.
You arrive at the location of the hoard, but discover that it was not quite as large as advertised.
You've arrived at the Long-Range Beacon. When the FTL Drive is charged you can jump to the next Sector.
Explore.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

An Auto-ship has been stationed here, but it does not turn hostile when it notices you. "Greetings tourist. I am the Lorekeeper, an automated ship tasked with keeping a full history of the glorious Rebellion and all its brilliant victories and rare defeats. A reward awaits those who take the time to listen to our 100% accurate historical retelling."
Listen to their "history".

"The Rebellion first began in 2757, founded by the now Admiral Vance Wentworth, a brilliant and handsome man who was dissatisfied with the way the Federation operated after 30 years of working under their command." As you start listening, you realise this is going to take a while.
Keep listening.

"It is common knowledge that the human race is superior to all other aliens. Therefore, it is the Rebellion's divine right to overthrow the Federation and establish a glorious, human only galactic government. Other aliens will be allowed to exist on the outskirts so long as they avoid communicating with humans.
Continue...

"The most known battle in Rebel history was the Battle of Node 17, often referred to as the Last Stand. The outcome of Node 17 has never been repeated except for Universe 0, the origins of multiverse travelers. Though the Federation was successful in defeating the Rebels, their celebration would not last for long after the Rebels discovered the mysterious Multiverse technology."
Continue...

"We owe our collective thanks to the brave heroes who have provided the other Rebels across the realities the chance to bring a better future to their galaxy. This concludes the retelling. Accept this complementary augment and supplies for taking the time to educate yourself."
Stop listening.
Almost the second you mute the Auto-ship, its weapons activate and it attacks!
Continue...
Stop listening.
Almost the second you mute the Auto-ship, its weapons activate and it attacks!
Continue...
Ignore the ship.
The ship does not try to contact you again.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
Rebel Elites are usually only seen in the Rebel Fleet, but it seems one of their ships is protecting this beacon. A fight is inevitable.
Continue...
A peculiar Auto-ship with blue lights reveals itself in this asteroid field. "This automated ship is a prototype Ion Deterrence Drone. Thank you for participating in this equipment test."
Continue...
"T-thank you ffff-or participa- in this test- test- test- test-" the Auto-ship is silenced by an explosion. In the wreckage you find a still functional, special Ion weapon.
A Rebel checkpoint identifies you as Federation. "You'll regret coming here, scum!"
Continue...

You brace for impact as soon as you recognize the formidable hull of an MFK Ace. However, two things are wrong here. The first, their logo is not the usual eagle, but a very poorly drawn fish. The second, the ship isn't attacking. The second question is answered when they hail you. The captain is leaning back in his chair, feet on the dashboard, and chewing on a sandwich. "You're lucky you caught us on our lunch break. You don't tell anyone about this, and we won't either."
Your logo looks like it was drawn by a toddler.
"Hey! This was the original design, before the idiots in command decided to stick with the eagle instead!" Enraged, the ship attacks.
Continue...
(Jerry) Compliment the logo.

"You really like it? This was the original design, before the idiots in command decided to stick with the eagle instead! Wait a minute- you're Jerry! How's it going, man? I haven't seen you since you were our best man at my wedding!" You aren't sure how these two hold a history together, but the Ace is so elated to see Jerry that he offers to work on your ship.
Agree not to fight.
The Rebel chuckles and turns off the screen. You carry on your way.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
The strange MFK ship has been defeated. You scrap the remains.
You jump in your seat when you see the Rebel Elite at this beacon. However, it seems they have not noticed you in return.
Attack the ship.
You prepare for combat with the elite.
Continue...
Avoid the Elite.
You don't feel like dying today. You steer clear of the elite Rebel.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.

A large Rebel station is orbiting a nearby planet. It seems to be an archive of data, and is very poorly armed. It is however protected by an MFK Ace. There must be very important data in that archive.
Attack the patrol ship to get to the Archive.
This will be one hell of a fight. You check to make sure everything is in order and ready for battle.
Continue...
Ignore the Archive.
Whatever data that Archive holds, fighting an MFK Ace isn't worth it.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
Seeing how you managed to take out one of the strongest classes of Rebel ships ever produced, the station isn't eager to fight back. They willingly surrender their facilities to you.
Download the data stores.

There's a lot more in the archive than you had even thought. You take only what you think would be useful, a map of the sector, and a beacon for merchants. You also take the liberty of deleting all data they have on the whereabouts of your ship.

On the nearby planet, there is a massive Rebel city that spans most of the planet's surface. A lot of Rebel and civilian ships are heading towards it, and you can see a stunning light show all the way from your ship. Something important must be going on.
Approach the city.

You avoid all of the Rebel patrols and find a landing pad who's staff doesn't ask any questions about who you are so long as you turn off your weapons when you leave. You leave your Federation badges in the ship and follow all the traffic to a giant stadium.
Continue...

In the center of the stage is an important looking Rebel politician, surrounded by 3 big screens projecting Rebel propaganda. You can just barely make out what he's saying over all the cheering from the crowd. "Friends and friends to be, we have all gathered here to celebrate the might of the Rebellion! We have received news that the new Rebel Flagship gifted to us by the Multiverse travelers has reached the Federation Capitol! The Federation's days are numbered, and soon the Rebellion shall rise and take its place!"
Send one of your crew to assassinate the politician.
You wish you had brought your ship, but if you go back now it may be too late. You use your handheld scanner to find a good vantage point and send one of your crew to prepare.
Continue...
(Elite Crew) Send your elite to assassinate the politician.

Your crew swiftly sneaks into the backstage, climbs onto the roof, and draws their rifle. It only takes one shot, and the lifeless body of the politician flops into the crowd, spraying the crowd with blood. Your crew hurries back, taking out two of the guards that try to follow on their way. The Fleet will be too busy dealing with all the chaos you've caused here, and likely won't be concerned with following you for a while.
(Slug Crew) Your Slug thinks they can hack into the screens.

Your Slug snickers as they hack into the screens' mainframe. They go black for a minute, confusing everyone in the crowd. A few seconds after, they switch to Federation propoganda. After a massively negative reception from the crowd and doubled efforts from the Rebels to counter the attack, your Slug gets tired and switches the screens over to a very explicit program. He breaks into laughter, and you hurry back into the ship before the Rebels can follow. When you return to the ship, you find a Soldier already waiting for you. Before you can raise your weapons, they hold up their hand to stop you. "No need to worry, I am on your side. I was sent to work undercover, but I haven't been able to contact the Federation for days. I was afraid I'd have to steal a Rebel shuttle to get back, but luckily I think I've found my way out with you guys instead."
Leave.
The politician salutes to the crowd, and they begin to chant "Glory to the Rebellion!" You hurry back to the ship and leave.
Ignore the planet.
Investigating a metropolis so deep inside enemy lines is suicide. Getting out of this sector is more important for your journey.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.

A suspicious amount of time passes without response from your crew. You're about to call them when a group of security guards come out onto the stage. Your heart drops when you see the bruised body of your crew member with them. They whisper something to the politician, who then says, "It appears this scum has attempted to take my life with a simple hand held laser! The Federation cannot see that a little gun will not stop the Rebellion!" The guards drop your crew onto the floor, and the politician swiftly draws an old Earth revolver and shoots them three times in the head. You quickly hurry out of the stadium before they can catch any more of you.
Luckily, by the time you've returned to the ship your crew is already waiting in the Clone Bay room, pouting about their failure and public execution.

A long time goes by, and you begin to fear the worse. Suddenly, you hear shouts and even screaming and your crew member comes charging back through the crowd, followed by a set of guards. You run back to the ship, the guards following in pursuit.

A few minutes after you sent your crew away, a loud bang echoes across the stadium. The politician's eyes go wide in surprise and they flop off the stage into the crowd. The entire place erupts into total chaos, civilians running in every direction. Your crew member comes rushing back, and you head back to the ship as fast as possible. With all the chaos you've caused, the Rebels are going to need to spend a lot of time on damage control. You doubt the Fleet will be concerned with following you for a while.
A small damaged colony lies in the distance. It appears to have once been under Rebel control, but the colonists revolted and broke free. You receive a hail from the colony, marked as urgent.
Respond.

"A Federation ship, here in the Rebel stronghold? Here, before us in our time of most dire need? This truly is our lucky day... As you can see, we have recently broken free from our Rebel oppressor. But it was not without loss. The Rebels took some of us as prisoners and are transporting them back to one of their high security containment facilities. We don't have the manpower to save them, but maybe you can? All you need to do is intercept the jailer ship. We placed a tracking beacon on it before it got away, so finding it won't be difficult."
Agree to track down the jailer.
"Oh thank you. I knew we could count on the Federation!"
We cannot risk our primary mission.
Avoid the colony.
While it's a relief to see opposition against the Rebel cause even in their territory, you do not have time to stop by and assist with whatever requests these colonists would ask from you.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
You've found the Jailer. They're already charging their FTL drive. You'll have to take them down before they can escape, and hopefully not destroy the ship in the process.
Continue...
The damaged ship hails you. "Y-you were sent by those colonists weren't you? Fine, you can have the prisoners back. Just let us live."
Accept the surrender and free the slaves.

The colonists are grateful for your help. As you do not have time to return to the colony, you drop them off at the nearest station, where they will be able to find a ship to help them. You are paid heavily for your assistance.
Screw the mission, let's kill these Rebel bastards.
You've destroyed the jailer, and no doubt all of the colonists onboard. The colony will never give you a reward now, so you'll have to be content with the scrap from the wreckage.
Without any of the Rebel crew onboard, you're able to scrap the exterior of the ship before checking on the prisoners.
Check on the colonists.

The colonists are grateful for your help. As you do not have time to return to the colony, you drop them off at the nearest station, where they will be able to find a ship to help them. You are paid heavily for your assistance.

The Jailer jumps away, and will no doubt arrive at the containment facility before you can catch it. That doesn't mean all hope is lost. You can still track the ship's location, and maybe defeat it before the prisoners are dropped off.

You've tracked down the jailer once again, but they've already transferred crew to a much stronger MFK Ace ship. It won't be an easy fight, and there will be no surrender. If you want to free the colonists, you'll have to kill their crew.
Try to rescue the colonists.
The Rebels aren't about to back down from a fight. The containment facility activates an ASB satellite to fire upon you.
Continue...
This is far too dangerous. We should go.
Without any of the Rebel crew onboard, you're able to scrap the exterior of the ship before checking on the prisoners.
Check on the colonists.

It is very dangerous to transport all of the colonists back to the colony now. With the MFK Ace still intact, most agree to steal the ship and pilot back. However, one colonist decides to stay with you. You are paid for your efforts as well.
You've destroyed the MFK Ace, and likely all of the colonists onboard. You'll have to be content with the salvage the ship provides, and leave quickly before the ASB can destroy you.

You arrive at the beacon to find yourself in a huge Rebel shipyard, scaffolding and construction drones filling the entire surrounding area! The entire system looks devoted to ship construction, the nearby planets and moons ruthlessly mined to harvest resources for ships of immense size...
Inspect the shipyard.

You move closer to the planet's surface, noticing a giant hangar. The ships inside must be enourmous in size. Around the outskirts are a few scattered Rebel ships patrolling. You could probably pick any one of them to fight.
Investigate the hangar.
You enter the hangar and are left in awe at the sight inside. A massive Multiverse Flagship, still under construction, rests inside. Killing this thing could save a whole other reality!
Fight the Flagship.

This could very well be just as important as your primary mission. You move in to attack the Flagship, as the crew of construction workers onboard quickly evacuate and are replaced by well trained human soldiers.
Continue...
Get the hell out of here.
You leave the hangar as quickly as possible and fly away from the shipyard until you're sure you're out of danger.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
Fight one of the normal Rebel ships.
You move in to intercept one of the regular Rebel ships.
Continue...
Fight one of the Elite Rebel ships.
You move in to intercept one of the Elite Rebel ships.
Continue...
Fight one of the MFK Ace Rebel ships.
You move in to intercept one of the MFK Rebel ships.
Continue...
Leave immediately.
You feel the mission is the highest priority and it's too risky to stay in such a dangerous location.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

You know with an infinite amount of potential realities there is thousands more Flagships out there, but without this one at least one more reality has been saved. It's a major victory, and there's countless scrap for you to collect, and even the blueprints of a Rebel cruiser left unprotected! Cautious of reinforcements arriving, you take as much as you can and leave. The Fleet will likely be too distracted dealing with this loss to follow you.

It's not much of a challenge nor will it have any impact on the Rebels, but killing this ship still means one less crew of Rebels to terrorize the galaxy. You scrap the remains quickly before reinforcements come.
It won't have much of an impact on the Rebels, but it's one less elite ship for them to throw at you. You scrap the remains quickly before reinforcements come.

The Rebels don't have many MFK Aces, and every one that you destroy is bound to put a big dent in their reserves. You quickly scrap the remains before reinforcements come, and while you're doing it you find a still functional weapon in the wreckage.
You detect no more lifesigns on the incomplete Flagship. You'd expect a ship of that size to have more security measures, but perhaps their computer systems aren't complete yet.
Pillage the ship for supplies.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

You arrive in a system and immediately discover a pirate ship nearby. Strangely, scans indicate there are no lifeforms aboard. You salvage anything useful, but find no clue as to the whereabouts of the former crew.
Not much remains in this abandoned system; however, scans reveal a nearby mining platform with some salvageable materials.
Debris from a forgotten battle still orbits the gas giant in this system. Some of it still might be usable.
You happen upon the remains of an automated space station. It has been mostly picked clean but there appears to be a few materials that will aid you in your mission.
A Rebel Engineer hails you. "I know this is a bit unconventional, but we are in need of drone-parts. We'll pay you in any other resource you want."
Give droneparts for scrap.
Give droneparts for fuel.
Give droneparts for ammunition.
Attack them!
You prepare to attack the engineers.
Continue...
Reject their offer.
You're good with what you have.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.
Luckily, the Auto-Support at this beacon is not designed for combat. If you were to convince it that you were a Rebel ship, maybe it will give you supplies.
Simply transmit your fake ID and hope for the best.
(Hacking) Reprogram the ship to distribute to Federation ships as well.
It appears that your injected code works. "Identification authorized. Dispensing supplies."
(Engi Crew) Reprogram the ship to distribute to Federation ships as well.
It appears that your Engi's modifications work. "Identification authorized. Dispensing supplies."
Ignore the Auto-Support.
It's not likely you can trick an AI vessel. You let it continue on its way.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
"Identification invalid. True identity: Federation vessel. Activating combat mode."
Continue...
"Rebel ship detected. Dispensing supplies."
Continue...
You discover one of the Rebel's autonomous scouts. The ship's AI wastes no time in engaging your ship.
Your ship is hailed: "This is an automated message. Resisting our takeover is pointless. Prepare to die." It appears this Rebel ship is run by an AI.
A Rebel autonomous vessel is exploring this beacon. You attempt to hide behind a nearby moon, but the ship finds you and begins its assault.
The AI of a nearby small Rebel auto-ship immediately identifies you as a threat and engages.
A Rebel ship moves in to engage. You attempt to open communications, but realize the futility of that action when you see the ship is run by an AI.
This must be one of the Rebels' unmanned scout ships. Looks like there's no way around a fight.
Another unmanned ship patrols this area. You prepare the ship for combat.
This beacon is being patrolled by an unmanned scout. A fight is unavoidable.
A small shuttle appears on the local radar. Turns out it is a Rebel automated scout!
Continue...

Your arrival is greeted by numerous computer alerts. The nearby automated Rebel Hacker has used a local satellite to deploy a virus to disrupt your Shields System. Hopefully it won't cause further problems before you can destroy it.
Continue...
(Hacking System) Counter the remote hacking.
Your hacking system automatically counters the digital assault and you move in to fight the ship.
Continue...
(Anti Virus) Counter the remote hacking.
Your Anti-Virus automatically counters the digital assault and you move in to fight the ship.
Continue...
Continue...

Though the primary Rebel fleet mostly avoids this sector, their Engineer vessels can still be found somewhat frequently. One of these ships has already arrived at this beacon and wastes no time to attack your ship.
You're hailed by a gruff looking Rebel engineer. "Frankly, I'm not paid enough for this job. Though at the same time, if I kill you maybe I'll get a raise!"
Only the Rebels could see the opportunity to make their engineer ships just as deadly as their primary fleet. One such ship spots you and attacks!
A Rebel Engineer ship is exploring this beacon. "Damn it, you should know very well that this sector is off limits!"

The Rebel Engineers are tasked with repairing damaged Auto-ships in this sector. That doesn't mean they aren't willing to get into a brawl with passing Federation ships. The ship here is evidence of this.
An engineer ship at this beacon is busy repairing a broken Auto-ship. As soon as they see you, they abandon the wreck and attack.
Continue...
You scrap what remains of the automated wreck.
Fight the Auto-ship.
You move in to intercept the automated vessel.
Continue...
Leave the Auto-ship alone.
You have no interest in the ship.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
You have discovered a dormant Auto-ship at this beacon. It makes no attempt to attack you, but the low power signatures from it suggest it is still functional.
An Auto-ship patrolling the sector has not yet spotted you at this beacon.
A prerecorded message plays over the intercomm. "It is advised that you do not attack this ship."
It appears it is not within the programming of the Auto-ship at this beacon to instigate combat. That doesn't mean however that it won't fight back should you choose to attack.

This beacon has been set up close to a lush forest planet. As you navigate closer to the surface, you can just barely make out a Rebel supply platform. It's likely staffed by a few Engineers, but nothing you can't manage.
Attack the platform.
Ignore the platform.
There's likely a defense system lying in wait for you. You abandon the station.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
As you approach the station, an automated ship comes flying out from its hiding place in the forest and attacks! You're forced to flee as the ship chases you.
Continue...
The platform was better defended than you were prepared for. Several Engineers are beamed onto your ship, and a powerful artillery cannon penetrates your defenses.
The Engineers are sent scattering as you attack the station. Not prepared in any way for combat, they're forced to surrender.
A ship full of Rebel engineers is under fire from a pirate vessel. They hail you, and request that you save them.
Save them from the pirate.
You move in to intercept the pirate vessel.
Continue...
We aren't going to help any damn Rebels.
You leave the two ships to continue fighting.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
The engineer ship is in poor condition. "I... I didn't expect you to actually help. I have no ship left, no crew... nothing. I suppose it will do me no harm to work aboard yours."
At this beacon you discover a pirate and Auto-ship fighting each other. Neither notices you.
Attack the Auto-Ship.
You move in to intercept the automated vessel.
Continue...
Attack the Pirates.
You move in to intercept the pirate ship.
Continue...
Ignore the ships.
You leave the two ships to continue fighting.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

"We weren't expecting support from a Federation ship. To be fair, I was looking forward to scrapping that ship. Despite this, I may be a pirate, but I am still a man who doesn't like keeping a debt. So here, take this garbage."
"Logic error: Federation ship provided aid in combat. Conflicting internal code... requires reboot." The Auto-ship turns offline. You take this chance to scrap it.
Inside the asteroid field at this beacon is a mining platform and an Automated Salvager ship. The Salvager does not notice you as it mines away at the asteroids.
Attack the ship to get to the platform.
You prepare to engage the Auto-ship.
Continue...
Ignore the ship.
Fighting a mining ship in its natural habitat of an asteroid field doesn't sound like a good idea.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
The automated platform holds many fuel cells freshly mined from the asteroid field. You take all that you can.
An Automated ship is patrolling what appears to be a ammunition manufacturing plant. You can't access the factory while the ship is in the way.
Attack the ship.
You prepare to engage the Auto-ship.
Continue...
Ignore the factory.
You aren't interested in raiding the factory.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

Now that the patrol ship has been taken out, the automated factory has begun to sound an alarm. A robotic voice counts down a timer until the factory explodes. You only have time to grab one thing if you want to escape unharmed.
Grab some ammunition.
You grab as much ammunition as you can carry and fly away before the factory can explode.
Grab one of the weapons.
You grab the nearest ballistic weapon and fly away before the factory can explode.
Grab all that you can, even if it means taking some damage.

You grab the nearest ballistic weapon and as much ammunition as you can carry. Luckily you escape before the explosion can do critical damage to the hull, but several chunks of debris collide with it regardless, inflicting some damage.

This beacon hosts an automated ship, but not of the usual variety. It's a Surveyor, a class deployed by the Rebels to scout out sectors autonomously. If you can capture its black box, you should be able to access the data.
Attack the ship.
Luckily Auto-ship black boxes can survive most damage from combat. Destroy the ship and the data is yours.
Continue...
Avoid the Surveyor.
The Rebel's data is intriguing, but you have decided against messing with the Surveyor.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

"This Automated ship has taken damage in combat. It will now proceed to escape. Do not cause further damage to this ship." Now that the Surveyor has seen you, if it can get away it'll report your location to the fleet!
The Surveyor jumps away, and will no doubt report your location to the fleet next.
You scrap the remains of the Auto-Surveyor, and bring aboard its black box. You have two options, either transmit false data to the Rebels to delay them, or download it to get a sector map.
Send it to the Rebels.
This should delay them for a while, or at least until they realize it's a hoax.
Download the data.
The Surveyor appears to have collected highly detailed data on the sector. This should help considerably.

An automated ship emitting this distress beacon signal is looping a message in a calming female voice. "This automated vessel has received critical hull damage. It has been programmed to give a reward to anyone who repairs it."
Assist in repairs.
A long bent arm comes out of the Auto-ship and collects the scrap. You watch in fascination as it patches itself back together.
Continue...
Destroy the ship.
The damaged ship is in horrible condition, but it still manages to raise its weapons and defend itself.
Continue...
Avoid the ship.
You'd have to be an absolute idiot to invest time into repairing an enemy auto-ship.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
Barely anything remains that can be scrapped from the Auto-ship.
Nearly a second after the Auto-ship finished repairing itself, the Auto-ship detects you as an enemy and attacks!
Continue...
"Repairs complete. Thank you for your service. As promised, here is your reward. Glory to the Rebellion!" The Auto-ship spits out a drone and jumps away.
"Repairs complete. Thank you for your service. As promised, here is your reward. Glory to the Rebellion!" The Auto-ship spits out an augment and jumps away.
You're startled by the Ghost ship, very out of place in this automated sector. They send you a message, reading "Hi, Hello. We need wreck. You have guns. Guns make wreck. We make deal?"
Agree to their request.
The Ghosts send one more message, with the co-ordinates of the ship they desire to capture.
We can't help.
The Ghosts send one last message, reading "You suck." They jump away.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
The Auto-ship at this beacon is completely active and ready for combat. It locks onto your ship and attacks!
Continue...
You've done as the Ghosts asked and reduced the Auto-ship to a wreck. Now what?
Wait for the Ghosts.
The Ghost ship jumps in not long after the Auto-ship was destroyed. "Yes good, this is what we want." They inspect the wreckage thoroughly.
Continue...
"No... Not enough space. We cannot fit full crew in this. You must take extras." They beam one of their crew onboard.
Scrap the wreckage.
You quickly salvage the wreckage and prepare to jump away before the Ghosts arrive.

In the distance appears to just be an ordinary planet, though the vast complex built on the surface interests you. Further scans reveal a morbid truth - a primarily automated Auto-ship factory running entirely on Zoltan slave power has been constructed on the surface!
Approach.

You fly closer to the surface, but are immediately met by a large Auto-Battleship, but it's not attacking yet. "This is Dr. Peron Anderson. Your vessel has been spotted coming concerningly close to the facility. We suggest either stating your business or getting lost."
Attack the Auto-ship!
The scientist sighs, then ends the call. Weapons spring out of the Auto-ship's hull, and it's time for a brawl.
Continue...
Buy a Zoltan.
"You... want one of our power sources? Well, I guess we don't need THIS many of them, and the scrap is handy... alright, you've got a deal."
We'll just leave.
Ignore the planet.
You'd have to be insane to tangle with such a massive structure that's undoubtedly of high value to the Rebels.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
A damaged Engineer vessel orbits this beacon. It appears to still be functional, and a single hull repair drone is patching up some of the damage.
Hail them.

"Ugh, you aren't here to kill us, are you?" You shake your head. "Oh, good. In that case, maybe you could help us. We had an issue with a cognitive prototype we were working on. After the Free Roamer incident, the Rebellion banned all attempts at creating fully sentient ship AI. We uh... we broke that rule, and it was a terrible mistake. Now the Auto-ship has escaped. You don't suppose you could track it down and destroy it? We can't let command know about this slip-up..."
Pick off the ship.
These guys make an easy target. You arm the weapons.
Continue...
Ignore the ship.
The Engineer makes no attempt to hail you in return. Just in case, you put a little distance between your ships.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
Location of the rogue Rebel cognitive.
Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

You've arrived at the co-ordinates given by the Engineers, but instead you've found a crashed starliner converted into a massive city bustling with pirates. A prime place to find a rogue AI, but not an easy one to search through.
Land and ask around.

Fortunately, the pirates don't really seem to care that you're a Federation officer. Living so close to Rebel space, it's probably a nice change of pace if anything. Asking around about a rogue cognitive however turns up confusing results. Most people have no idea what a cognitive is, and most redirect you to speak with the king of the city.
Go see the king.

You step into a massive, cobbled together tower of spliced cargo containers and the hulls of former Rebel ships. In the center sits a throne, on which rests a rotund man with a black paper hat staring down upon you. He isn't particularly imposing, save for the buzzsaw that apparently has replaced his left hand. "I see yee have found me in my d-d-dominion. Welcome, matey!"
Continue...

The man 'stands' up, revealing he in-fact has no feet, but rather a set of treads. He rolls towards you, and it becomes clear this is no man at all, but rather a ramshamble Doctor Drone. "Arg, I be Cap'ain A5540L3, at your service. How might I help you, lad?" The drone sticks out his left hand to shake yours before he remembers his situation, and so quickly stuffs it behind his back and reaches out his right instead, which is instead a much less imposing but still concerning blaster arm from a Battle Drone.
Shake his "hand".
Get right to business.
Avoid the city.
This mission isn't worth stirring up an entire city of pirates. You pull away from the city.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
You carefully grab his arm cannon and shake it up and down a few times. "Arg, mighty grip you've got there, lad! Now, surely there's a reason the Federation's come prodding around here."
Explain why you're here.

It doesn't take a genius to realize this is the cognitive in question, and you waste no further time explaining the situation to him. "Hmmm. Sounds grave, matey. You surely understand I'm not just gonna r-r-roll out of here with you."
Then we have a standoff, don't we?

"Arg, it would appear so." A55 does his best to clap, then whistles. Seconds later, a massive Auto-Dreadnaught comes whirling by through a hole in the ceiling of the massive throne room. "Last chance lad, I don't wanna cause no bloodshed t-t-today."
Prepare to fight!

Curiously, A55's massive vessel makes no attempt to fight you until you get into your cruiser, though it easily could have blown your crew away during the run. You have no time to contemplate this further, it's time to fight!
Continue...
Leave.
Leave him alone.
You turn and walk out of the room. A55 watches you leave in mild amusement and confusion.

Suddenly, the Dreadnaught shuts offline, falling to the ground. In the distance approaches the engineers from earlier, here to collect their AI. You don't have time to hail them before you receive another hail from A55. "Please matey, don't hand me over. They'll tear me apart and turn me offline! That's no proper fate for a pirate, arg!"
Hand over A55.

You grab the medic drone, carting him over to the Engineers. "He's integrated himself into a new chassis? Incredible! It's a shame we'll have to destroy it, but at least this drone will look cool as a trophy. Don't speak of this to anyone."
Lie to the Engineers, tell them the Auto-ship is A55.

A55 hides while you inform the engineers about the Auto-ship, which they briefly scan. The engineer frowns, "Huh, I can see traces of his programming here, but it looks like the core migrated to a new chassis. This must have been a distraction, we'll have to keep searching. Here's your pay or something. Don't speak of this to anyone."
Continue...

"Thank you, matey. Arg, though you did choose to try and murder me a few minutes ago, your heart is clearly in the right place lad. I suspect my time here as king might be short lived, those Engineers will come around again. But as I prepare to leave, take this."
Continue...

"Thank you, matey. Arg, though you did choose to try and murder me a few minutes ago, your heart is clearly in the right place lad. I suspect my time here as king might be short lived, those Engineers will come around again. I think I shall come with you, in hopes I might live to see a future without Rebels."
The reactor will detonate in this much time. Nothing can stop this, so make sure to jump away or end the fight before it reaches 0!
It appears a large generator has been sculpted onto the face of a nearby snow planet. It's quite a spectacle, but something is wrong...
Continue...

A battalion of pirate ships flies away, chased off by a distant Rebel ship. A warning plays over the intercom. "It is recommended that all personnel evacuate Power Grid 800 immediately. Catastrophic reactor failure is imminent. Estimated 3 minutes remaining until collapse."
There's time left, swing by and try to salvage some supplies.

As you move in to salvage, you're stopped by a large Engineer vessel. "Damn pirates! We told you to get the hell out of here!" Though the ship moves in to chase you off, you can't help but notice that reactor countdown is still going, and you figure the Engineers must know as well.
Continue...
Abide the warning and leave.

Suddenly, the Engineer ship jumps away so abruptly, they must have used an MV drive, leaving you alone with the power core. You receive another warning from the core. "Warning: Reactor instability has reached 99%. Destruction is imminent. Evacuate immediately. Estimated 3 seconds remaining until collapse."
Crap.
(Upg. Engines) Get the hell out of there.
(Adv. Engines) Get the hell out of there.

You've defeated the Engineer ship, but that victory won't last for long. You receive another warning from the core. "Warning: Reactor instability has reached 99%. Destruction is imminent. Evacuate immediately. Estimated 3 seconds remaining until collapse."
Crap.
(Upg. Engines) Get the hell out of there.
(Adv. Engines) Get the hell out of there.

The Engineer ship has taken critical damage. Before you can get in a finishing shot you're interupted by another alarm. "Warning: Reactor instability has reached 97%. Evacuate the premises immediately. Estimated 1 minute remaining until collapse."
Urge the Engineers to stop fighting.

"You think we can just leave? It's a better fate to blow the hell up than face Vance's wrath! I'd rather die fighting the Federation and become a martyr than-" The engineers are cut off by another warning. "Warning: Reactor instability has reached critical levels. Destruction imminent, evacuation mandatory. Time remaining: undetermined. Repeat: reactor-" The message continues to loop, and it seems like it's a good warning. Surely, there's nothing you can do to stop the explosion?
Send in your crew to fix the reactor, and quickly!

You pull closer to the power core, and drop off your crew. They hurry inside to the control pannel, which is sparking. There's 3 buttons, but their labels are barely legible. Pressing one of them might save the day, but you have no idea which.
Press the big red one.
Your crew flips open the protective casing and smashes the button as fast as they can. Now you can only hope it worked...
Continue...
Press the small blue one.
Your crew flips open the protective casing and smashes the button as fast as they can. Now you can only hope it worked...
Continue...
Press the square green one.
Your crew flips open the protective casing and smashes the button as fast as they can. Now you can only hope it worked...
Continue...
(Emergency Manual) Read the manual.

You rapidly flip through the manual, and sure enough under the section for "Rebel Automated Power Core Explosion Prevention Protocols" it clearly states to press the red button. You relay this to the crew, who flips open the protective casing and smashes the button as fast as they can.
Continue...
(Enginer Crew) Have your engineer help.

Your engineer searches deep through their memories and remembers a staff training day where they explained the importance of each button. Recalling the red button was the correct solution, you relay this to the crew who flips open the protective casing and smashes the button as fast as they can.
Continue...
Leave, now!

You power up the engines and fly as far away as you can, and watch from a distance as the mothership is consumed by a massive explosion that rips through the planet's surface leaving a crater so large you can see it all the way from the other side of the system. You pull a little closer and scrap the wreckage on the outer rim, though the center is leaking heavy radiation and is not safe to journey towards.
Keep fighting to the bitter end.

An ear splitting explosion reverbs throughout the ship as a deadly inferno consumes the power core. Your ship is caught in the explosion, and takes heavy damage. You fly away as quickly as possible, your engines burning up as you go.
You speed away from the power core as fast as you possible can. You escape the initial explosion, but much of the debris still collides with your ship, causing damage to the hull.
Your advanced engines are easily able to get you out in time. You watch the explosion from a safe distance.

A loud beep emminates from the console. "Emergency Reactor Meltdown Prevention button pressed. Stopping countdown to imminent explosion. Reactor stabilized." By some incredible miracle, it appears you've stopped the explosion.
Continue...
The Engineers are amazed. "I-I didn't even know that button was a thing! You've saved all of us... but why? Why put your life on the line just to save a Rebel facility?"
My moral compass is legendary.

"Perhaps we are fighting for the wrong side here... Regardless, we must leave this facility at once. Vance won't be happy we let that pirate raid almost destroy the reactor and I doubt he'd let us live through it. I'll come with you, and bring everything that I can with me."
If you do not defeat the MFK Ace in this amount of time, the transport will escape!
The MFK Ace has been destroyed. You hastily scrap the remains then check on the transport.
Continue...
The MFK Ace has been defeated. You hastily scrap the remains then check on the transport.
Continue...

An MFK Ace ship is conversing with a transport, surprisingly not on an encrypted frequency. However, it seems obvious why. They're talking of nothing important, and you consider just passing them by, when suddenly the conversation shifts. The MFK, adressing the transport's captain, asks, "So, you're heading to the Protectorate, right?" The transport captain nods, briefly taking a cigarette out of his mouth to let out a simple "Yessiree".
The "Protectorate"? Keep listening...

The Ace leans in closer, eager to pry more details from the captain. "Really now? You gotta tell me what goes on in there. Years ago, Vance brought this scruffy little blonde kid to training, said he was his nephew or somethin'. He was some 3 years our junior, but he kicked every Ace's ass in combat practice, then waddled off to go draw a horse with some crayons on the wall. Then one day, Vance came back and yanked the kid. Don't know what happened to him, but I heard after director Black retired, Vance put her in the Protectorate to watch over his nephew."
Continue...

The other Rebel captain nods, but the look on his face suggests he's growing impatient. "Yeah, yeah. Okay, cool exposition. But why are you telling me this? Are you supposed to be off, I dunno, killing Feds? I got a job to do buddy, I can't sit here on my ass all day. Get to the point." The Ace shrugs, displeased about his tone. "Look, what I'm asking for is some... you know, inside info? Surely, you got some if you go to and from that place all day."
Continue...

The captain shakes his head. "First off, anything I could tell you, I can't. Closed lips on all that jazz. Second off, I don't know shit either. All I'll say is this - rumor's are right about Cyra running the place, and she keeps a tight ship. I've never been past the wall. Well, a glimpse. But it's nothin' special. Now, get out of my way." The MFK Ace is indignant that even he has been refused information, but he only growls and moves his ship out of the transport's way. If you want to pursue this, now's your chance.
Follow that transport!
You take this moment to reveal yourself, and immediately the transport begins to charge its FTL drive. The MFK Ace flings itself to face you, weapons charging. You've gotta be quick about this!
Continue...
Politely ask for the co-ordinates.

The Rebel soldiers stare at you, utterly confused. You wait a little longer in desperate hope but, as you should have expected, the Rebels have no intent of giving you the information. The transport immediately begins to charge its FTL drive. The MFK Ace flings itself to face you, weapons charging. You've gotta be quick about this!
Continue...
Do nothing.
Weird deja vu, but we've heard this all before.
Ignore the Rebels.
This conversation isn't worth your time. You distance yourself from the Rebels.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
It seems you're out of time. In the distance, the transport escapes, and once the Ace realizes this they show an uncharacteristic display of cowardice and run as well!

The transport makes every attempt to flee, and you follow them in hot pursuit. Unfortunately, they manage to slip away - but not all is lost. During the struggle you managed to get a lock on their FTL signatures, and now you can follow them during hyperspeed!
You've arrived at the Long-Range Beacon. When the FTL Drive is charged you can jump to the next Sector.
We should leave quickly.
You've arrived at the Long-Range Beacon. When the FTL Drive is charged you can jump to the next Sector.
Continue...
Continue...
Continue...
Continue...
Continue...

"Damn... damn it all to hell. I've failed you, Vance. And at the hands of some second-rate Renegade from U0 no less. I'm sorry Jerry. Give your uncle my... my best wishes..." With that, Cyra has been vanquished.
Continue...

Jerry is devastated. "I thought... you didn't have to kill her... We could have talked our way out. This was a mistake. Now the blood of my friend is on my hands, and this all could have been avoided if I just stayed put! Damn it! Go on, leave me here. This was all a big mistake..."
It seems Jerry is gone for good. You'll have to carry on with your mission without him.
Continue...
It seeems Jerry didn't survive the fight. An unfortunate and anticlimactic end to this story, but you don't have much else to salvage it.

Cyra's ship is in poor condition, but before you can continue the fight, Jerry pulls you aside. "Please, whatever you do, don't kill Cyra. She can't keep fighting like this for much longer, we can get through this without her dying! Please, I know you're a mercenary and a Federation one at that, but there doesn't need to be more bloodshed today!"
You've managed to hold out just long enough, and eventually Cyra's ship comes to a halt. Cyra herself has collapsed, unable to fight any longer, and she reluctantly surrenders.
Continue...

With the ship neutralized, you dock at Jerry's request and he rushes aboard to meet Cyra. The wounded Ace is still alive, and with treatment could surely make it out in one piece, but something else is wrong. "I've failed. I had one job, one promise. I'm useless. Jerry... send my regards to Vance..." With that, Cyra draws out her gun, aims it at herself, and pulls the trigger.
Continue...
Jerry has no idea what to say. "I... she didn't have to... oh no. I caused all of this. What have I done?"
Don't blame yourself, kid. Vance would have gotten her anyways.

"What? No! Vance would never have hurt her, especially not with their history. I don't think my uncle even realizes what he's doing. He has a mission, and people go rabid about it. They'll die for him even when he's never asked for it. I need to see him, I'm the only person he'll listen to. I can talk him out of this... make him see the damage he's caused. I'm no good as a fighter, but maybe if you can take me to Node 17, I can put an end to this fighting for good." Jerry looks around him. "As for this ship... well, it's not much use to us anymore. I guess you can take the blueprints. Come on, let's... let's go. I don't want to linger."
Continue...

"I... I failed... and the kid didn't even survive the fight. What have I done... Damn... damn it all to hell. I'm sorry Vance..." Cyra pulls out her gun, and with trembling fingers aims it at herself and pulls the trigger.

Nearby looms a massive cruiser unlike any you've seen. Aboard the ship are multiple Aces, and their leader, a short but powerfully built woman with long black hair: Cyra Black, the first MFK Ace. She eyes you, but she makes no motions to attack. "You harbor Wentworth's nephew on your vessel. I know you aren't dumb, though your actions might be. You and I both know you aren't getting out of this sector with the kid without going through me first. Give him back to me, or we'll have to do this the unpleasant way."
Refuse.

You refuse, and at Jerry's own request, you put him on the line. He tries to appeal to Cyra, but she refuses. "Jerry, I made a promise to your uncle that I would never let anything happen to you. I will die before I break my promise to Vance. If it's a fight you want Renegade, then it's a fight you'll get."
Continue...
Give her Jerry.

You aren't willing to go up against Cyra about this. Jerry will be in good hands anyways - it's not like he hasn't been under her protection for most of his life. Jerry seems a bit disappointed, but he doesn't fight back. A fairly anticlimactic ending to this story, but better than one with death.
It seems Jerry is gone for good. You'll have to carry on with your mission without him.
"Damn... damn it all to hell. I've failed you, Vance. And at the hands of some second-rate Renegade from U0 no less. Ugh..." Cyra has been defeated.

Nearby looms a massive cruiser unlike any you've seen. Aboard the ship are multiple Aces, and their leader, a short but powerfully built woman with long black hair: Cyra Black, the first MFK Ace. She eyes you, but she makes no motions to attack. "I've heard word of your movements in this sector. I know who you are, but I don't care. I've long since retired, but I give you one warning. If you so much as hurt one hair on the head of Jerome Wentworth, I will personally see to it that your throat is slit. Understand?"
Sure?
"Good. Then get out of my sector."
Take this chance to attack her!
"Typical. Renegades always follow the same course no matter what. To the grave you go, then."
Continue...

Nearby looms a massive cruiser unlike any you've seen. Aboard the ship are multiple Aces, and their leader, a short but powerfully built woman with long black hair: Cyra Black, the first MFK Ace. She eyes you, but she makes no motions to attack. "I've heard word of your movements in this sector. I know who you are, but I don't care. I heard what happened at the estate. You're lucky Jerome got out alive, or else you'd be dead where you stand. Don't test your luck. Understand?"
Sure?
"Good. Then get out of my sector."
Take this chance to attack her!
"Typical. Renegades always follow the same course no matter what. To the grave you go, then."
Continue...

Nearby looms a massive cruiser unlike any you've seen. Aboard the ship are multiple Aces, and their leader, a short but powerfully built woman with long black hair: Cyra Black, the first MFK Ace. She eyes you, the fires of vengeance in her eyes. "You son of a bitch. Are you happy with what you've done? I hope you are. Because it's the last damn mistake you've ever made. You shouldn't have hurt that kid, but you did, and now it's personal."
Uh oh.
